thread.title: Collins relishing in full-time role in Arkansas' backfield
thread.title_full: Collins relishing in full-time role in Arkansas' backfield

title: Collins relishing in full-time role in Arkansas' backfield
text:
Collins relishing in full-time role in Arkansas' backfield after dominant 3-game stretch By KURT VOIGT AP Sports Writer First Posted: October 08, 2015 - 4:03 pmLast Updated: October 08, 2015 - 4:03 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 
Arkansas (508) 

FAYETTEVILLE, Arkansas — After two understated 1,000-yard rushing seasons in a part-time role Arkansas' backfield, Alex Collins has taken advantage of a full-time opportunity this season. 
Collins, despite some initial struggles this season filling the void left by injured running back Jonathan Williams, has entered rare territory in the last three weeks as the Razorbacks (2-3, 1-1 Southeastern Conference) have tried to recover from a disappointing start to the season. 
The 5-foot-11, 215-pound running back has rushed for more than 150 yards in each of the Razorbacks last three games, joining two-time Heisman Trophy runner-up Darren McFadden as the only other player in school history to accomplish that feat. 
Arkansas travels to No. 8 Alabama (4-1, 1-1) on Saturday.
